intro: Oxydectes caudata, commonly known as the purple globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces showy, purple or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. Oxydectes caudata is adapted to drought conditions and is considered a hardy, resilient species.
